movie.title: The Holdovers
movie.notes: Nostalgic movie, especially for anyone that grew up in the 70's and/or went to boarding school. Themes include the divide between people who are privileged and not, and those who are ostracized or revered. Lots of character growth. Great story, great acting. Also touches upon mental illness and grieving the loss of a loved one.

movie.title: Red One
movie.notes: Holiday movie with Luci Liu, The Rock and Chris Evans. Terrible plot, terrible writing. Don't waste your time unless you are looking for a light-hearted fantasy, holiday, action movie.

movie.title: Yacht Rock: A Dockumentary
movie.notes: For anyone who grew up in the 70's and 80's an listened to pop music.

movie.title: Juror #2
movie.notes: Watchable, but not a great movie, by any means.

movie.title: Poor Things
movie.notes: As simple and elegant an answer to the "What is the ultimate meaning of life, the universe, and Everything" as 42.

movie.title: Heretic
movie.notes: Fun to think critically about religion. A little unnecessarily creepy at the end.

movie.title: Don't look back
movie.notes: Great to see old footage of Dylan.

movie.title: The Greatest Beer Run
movie.notes: A little too sugary for a story about Vietnam, but a story worth making a movie about.

movie.title: A Complete Unknown
movie.notes: Bob Dylan Biopic. Had low expectations going in, but Chalemet killed it. Really put Dylan's formative years into perspective.
